      • findPicks

        public static int findPicks(double[] data,
            int nsamp,
            int width,
            double minCorrelation,
            double[] hist,
            int[] picks,
            java.lang.StringBuilder err)
        This is a static function to find "picks" from an array of correlations from the correlation picker data. The routine looks for data points greater than a minimum value for a correlation, and then looks inside of its window for the maximum correlation within that time frame. The picks are returned as an array of indices into the data array and the number of such picks is the return value. Since there is a history, it is possible that the index of a returned pick is negative relative to the first data point in history.

        Since the history is being maintained separately this routine has a performance penalty in that it has to create the full array (history + new data) so that it can be computed. This insures a copy of every data point in data has to be done.

        Parameters:
        data - the correlation array with new correlation data
        nsamp - The number of data points in the array
        width - The width of the minimum window size (array elements before retriggering is possible)
        minCorrelation - The minimum correlation that might be considered as a real match
        hist - A history array at least maximum nsamp in data + width in size assumes next call will contain correlation of data[nsamp+1]
        picks - The array of pick indices returned, must be big enough to contain all the picks (data.length/width+1)
        err - A String builder with information about the error.
        Returns:
        The number of elements in picks[]

      • findPicks

        public static int findPicks(double[] data,
            int offset,
            int nsamp,
            int width,
            double minCorrelation,
            int[] picks,
            java.lang.StringBuilder err)
        This is a static function to find "picks" from an array of correlations from the correlation picker data. The routine looks for data points greater than a minimum value for a correlation, and then looks inside of its window for the maximum correlation within that time frame. The picks are returned as an array of indices into the data array and the number of such picks is the return value.

        This is preferred method since it saves having to copy the data around and maintain a large history buffer.

        If just starting (no history), you an set offset=0 and add the new data. In this case be aware that no pick can occur before width/2

        typical call will be if there are width data points of old data from last call at beginning of the data array and nsamp of new data starting at offset width have been added :

        int npick = findPicks(data,width, nsamp,width,minCorrelation, picks, sb);

        Parameters:
        data - the correlation array with new data starting at offset+nwidth
        offset - the offset into the data array that contains the first new data point
        nsamp - The number of new data points in the array (first new point at offset)
        width - The width of the minimum window size (array elements before retriggering is possible)
        minCorrelation - The minimum correlation that might be considered as a real match
        picks - The array of pick indices returned, must be big enough to contain all the picks (data.length/width+1)
        err - A String builder with information about the error.
        Returns:
        The number of elements in picks[], if less than 0 then an error is being reported

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        test routine - reads in some data Harley sent from station MOKD on day 348
        Parameters:
